I guess I should've expected this. My eyesight has been getting worse and worse due to my illness.

I couldn't help but feel a shock when I saw the sketches.

With my job getting fewer and fewer, and my savings dwindling away, is it any surprise that I ended up turning to loansharking?

It's all just a cycle of misery, really. The end result of trying to be a model student.

And then, to top it all off, my dad had to drag me down to the river to pay off my debts with a baseball bat. What an awful parent, huh?

Anyway, in the end, Ren-san became the model.

But... it's all just so pointless, isn't it?

Even if I had drawn something amazing, it wouldn't have been worth much anyway. Not compared to what they were making.

I guess that's just the way it is.

prompt.content:
Given a sequence of texts representing some pages of manga in Japanese, generate a high-quality English translation that accurately conveys the meaning and emotion of the original text. Each input line corresponds to a speech bubble or narration box in the manga, so please ensure that the number of output lines exactly matches the number of input lines. For example, if the input is:
テキスト1
テキスト2
テキスト3

The output should be:

text1
text2
text3

Please do not provide any explanation in the output other than the translation itself.

だからっ
知らないって言ってるだろっ
そんな借金なんて!
そうは言ってもなぁ
レーネ...
